| Section5 = {{Chembox Related Function = alkanes OtherFunctn =
}} }} 'Pentane' is an organic compound with the formula
C 5H 12 â that is, an alkane with five carbon atoms. The
term may refer to any of three structural isomers, or to a mixture of them: in
the IUPAC nomenclature, however, 'pentane' means exclusively the n-pentane
isomer; the other two being called "methylbutane" and "dimethylpropane".
Cyclopentane is not an isomer of pentane.

Pentanes are components of some fuels and are employed as specialty
solvents in the laboratory. Their properties are very similar to those of
butanes and hexanes.
